intro: Platychorda, commonly known as the narrowleaf yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with linear, grass-like leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers. Platychorda thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it an important plant in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
